𓏏 𓇼 𓄿 𓇳 |dawn, morning| DAWN! 旦 dàn

𓇼 𓄿 𓇳 djournéra ≈ Dorn ≈ dawn 𓆓 𓂝 𓈖 / 𓂝 𓈖 𓆓 𓇳 𓇯 𓈌

𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | day dawn 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | طوغمه doğma طوغ doğ- “to be born” + مه -ma 𒌉 DUMU ≈ doğmak Tag

𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | The East 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | дорно dorno dawn 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | •Tzamin in مشرق زمین mašreq-zamin <> 𒅎 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | itä, itämaat, idamaa, idamaad ≈ east 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | Turk > Шарқ Šarq شرق šarq схід sxid 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East | Thai 東方／东方 Dōngfāng, 東洋／东洋 Dōngyáng 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | The East, sunrise | طلوع tolu' (Ana)Tolia ανατολή anatolí 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | east, eastern, left-hand, the East | east / eastern 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | day dawn 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | طوغمه doğma دمیدن damidan 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | 天 上 tiānshàng 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | ᦎᦱᦞᧃᦀᦸᧅᧈ ṫaavan˙ʼoak¹ ថ្ងៃរះ thngay rĕəh 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 | sunrise | •turk सूर्योदय sūryoday 𓇳 𓏏 𓋁 𓏮 ortus ++

dawn > dayn
dawn > δwn > sun ?

The forms of the name Tengri (Old Turkic: Täŋri)[7] among the ancient and modern Turks and Mongols are Tengeri, Tangara, Tangri, Tanri, Tangre, Tegri, Tingir, Tenkri, Teri, Ter, and Ture.[8] The name Tengri ("the Sky") is derived from Old Turkic: Tenk ("daybreak") or Tan ("dawn").[9] Meanwhile, Stefan Georg proposed that the Turkic Tengri ultimately originates as a loanword from Proto-Yeniseian *tɨŋgɨr- "high".
